newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-JUVENTUS HELD TO DRAW BY PART-TIMERS IN ITALIAN CUP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JUVENTUS HELD TO DRAW BY PART-TIMERS IN ITALIAN CUP.

text.p: League leaders and European champions Juventus were held to a goalless draw in the third round of the Italian cup on Wednesday by Nocerina -- a team of part-timers who have just replaced their manager.
The 0-0 scoreline in the match, played before a crowd of 35,000 in the southern city of Avellino because Nocerina do not have a stadium big enough, was the shock result of a night of seven ties.
It earned serie C side Nocerina, who had seen off first division clubs Piacenza and Perugia on their way to the last 16, a lucrative replay away to Juventus, probably on November 6.
Both teams had a man sent off in the 48th minute in a match which also saw the referee show five yellow cards.
Second division side Genoa also had a game to remember, holding serie A Vicenza 1-1 in the night's only other draw. Both goals came from penalties.
Roberto Baggio scored a brace of goals as AC Milan booked a quarter-final berth with a 2-0 victory against Reggiana.
The only lower division side certain of place in the quarter-finals are Cremonese who won 2-1 away to fellow serie B side Cesena.
Nocerina hail from of Nocera Inferiore, a run down small town in the Naples hinterland.
Their coach, Gianni Balugani, was only brought in this week after his predecessor was sacked with the side one place from the bottom of serie C.
"If someone had told me a couple of months ago that I'd be returning to the bench on the eve of a game against Juve I'd have said he was mad," Balugani, 50, said before the match.
The two teams last met 18 years ago, also in the Italian cup, when Juventus won 3-1.
